info.title: CdnManagementClient
info.description: Use these APIs to manage Azure CDN resources through the Azure Resource Manager. You must make sure that requests made to these resources are secure.

get.description: Lists all of the CDN profiles within an Azure subscription.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists all of the CDN profiles within a resource group.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets a CDN profile with the specified profile name under the specified subscription and resource group.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile which is unique within the resource group.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates a new CDN profile with a profile name under the specified subscription and resource group.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile which is unique within the resource group.
Profile properties needed to create a new profile.
parameters.name: profile

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and a new profile has been created.

202.description: Accepted. The request has been accepted for processing and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates an existing CDN profile with the specified profile name under the specified subscription and resource group.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile which is unique within the resource group.

parameters.name: profileUpdateParameters
parameters.description: Profile properties needed to update an existing profile.

202.description: Accepted. The request has been accepted for processing and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes an existing CDN profile with the specified parameters. Deleting a profile will result in the deletion of all of the sub-resources including endpoints, origins and custom domains.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile which is unique within the resource group.

202.description: Accepted. The request has been accepted for processing and the operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: No Content. The request has been accepted but the profile was not found.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Generates a dynamic SSO URI used to sign in to the CDN supplemental portal. Supplemental portal is used to configure advanced feature capabilities that are not yet available in the Azure portal, such as core reports in a standard profile; rules engine, advanced HTTP reports, and real-time stats and alerts in a premium profile. The SSO URI changes approximately every 10 minutes.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile which is unique within the resource group.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Gets the supported optimization types for the current profile. A user can create an endpoint with an optimization type from the listed values.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: Name of the CDN profile which is unique within the resource group.

default.description: CDN error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Checks the quota and actual usage of endpoints under the given CDN profile.

Profile.description: CDN profile is a logical grouping of endpoints that share the same settings, such as CDN provider and pricing tier.

sku.description: The pricing tier (defines a CDN provider, feature list and rate) of the CDN profile.

ProfileProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a profile.

ProfileListResult.description: Result of the request to list profiles. It contains a list of profile objects and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of CDN profiles within a resource group.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of profile objects if there are any.

ProfileUpdateParameters.description: Properties required to update a profile.

SsoUri.description: The URI required to login to the supplemental portal from the Azure portal.

ssoUriValue.description: The URI used to login to the supplemental portal.

SupportedOptimizationTypesListResult.description: The result of the GetSupportedOptimizationTypes API

supportedOptimizationTypes.description: Supported optimization types for a profile.

EndpointProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create an endpoint.

hostName.description: The host name of the endpoint structured as {endpointName}.{DNSZone}, e.g. contoso.azureedge.net

origins.description: The source of the content being delivered via CDN.

originGroups.description: The origin groups comprising of origins that are used for load balancing the traffic based on availability.

EndpointListResult.description: Result of the request to list endpoints. It contains a list of endpoint objects and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of CDN endpoints within a profile

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of endpoint objects if there is any.

EndpointUpdateParameters.description: Properties required to create or update an endpoint.

EndpointPropertiesUpdateParameters.description: The JSON object containing endpoint update parameters.

originPath.description: A directory path on the origin that CDN can use to retrieve content from, e.g. contoso.cloudapp.net/originpath.

contentTypesToCompress.description: List of content types on which compression applies. The value should be a valid MIME type.

originHostHeader.description: The host header value sent to the origin with each request. This property at Endpoint is only allowed when endpoint uses single origin and can be overridden by the same property specified at origin.If you leave this blank, the request hostname determines this value. Azure CDN origins, such as Web Apps, Blob Storage, and Cloud Services require this host header value to match the origin hostname by default.

isCompressionEnabled.description: Indicates whether content compression is enabled on CDN. Default value is false. If compression is enabled, content will be served as compressed if user requests for a compressed version. Content won't be compressed on CDN when requested content is smaller than 1 byte or larger than 1 MB.

isHttpAllowed.description: Indicates whether HTTP traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) must be allowed.

isHttpsAllowed.description: Indicates whether HTTPS traffic is allowed on the endpoint. Default value is true. At least one protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) must be allowed.

queryStringCachingBehavior.description: Defines how CDN caches requests that include query strings. You can ignore any query strings when caching, bypass caching to prevent requests that contain query strings from being cached, or cache every request with a unique URL.

optimizationType.description: Specifies what scenario the customer wants this CDN endpoint to optimize for, e.g. Download, Media services. With this information, CDN can apply scenario driven optimization.

probePath.description: Path to a file hosted on the origin which helps accelerate delivery of the dynamic content and calculate the most optimal routes for the CDN. This is relative to the origin path. This property is only relevant when using a single origin.

geoFilters.description: List of rules defining the user's geo access within a CDN endpoint. Each geo filter defines an access rule to a specified path or content, e.g. block APAC for path /pictures/

defaultOriginGroup.description: A reference to the origin group.

urlSigningKeys.description: List of keys used to validate the signed URL hashes.

deliveryPolicy.description: A policy that specifies the delivery rules to be used for an endpoint.

rules.description: A list of the delivery rules.

webApplicationFirewallPolicyLink.description: Defines the Web Application Firewall policy for the endpoint (if applicable)

DeliveryRule.description: A rule that specifies a set of actions and conditions

order.description: The order in which the rules are applied for the endpoint. Possible values {0,1,2,3,………}. A rule with a lesser order will be applied before a rule with a greater order. Rule with order 0 is a special rule. It does not require any condition and actions listed in it will always be applied.

conditions.description: A list of conditions that must be matched for the actions to be executed

actions.description: A list of actions that are executed when all the conditions of a rule are satisfied.

DeliveryRuleAction.description: An action for the delivery rule.

name.description: The name of the action for the delivery rule.

UrlRedirectAction.description: Defines the url redirect action for the delivery rule.

parameters.description: Defines the parameters for the action.

UrlRedirectActionParameters.description: Defines the parameters for the url redirect action.

redirectType.description: The redirect type the rule will use when redirecting traffic.

destinationProtocol.description: Protocol to use for the redirect. The default value is MatchRequest

customPath.description: The full path to redirect. Path cannot be empty and must start with /. Leave empty to use the incoming path as destination path.

customHostname.description: Host to redirect. Leave empty to use the incoming host as the destination host.

customQueryString.description: The set of query strings to be placed in the redirect URL. Setting this value would replace any existing query string; leave empty to preserve the incoming query string. Query string must be in <key>=<value> format. ? and & will be added automatically so do not include them.

customFragment.description: Fragment to add to the redirect URL. Fragment is the part of the URL that comes after #. Do not include the #.

UrlSigningActionParameters.description: Defines the parameters for the Url Signing action.

secretSource.description: Resource reference to the KV secret

algorithm.description: Algorithm to use for URL signing

parameterNameOverride.description: Defines which query string parameters in the url to be considered for expires, key id etc.

ipSubnets.description: Match values to match against. Supports CIDR ranges (both IPv4 and IPv6).

UrlSigningParamIdentifier.description: Defines how to identify a parameter for a specific purpose e.g. expires

paramIndicator.description: Indicates the purpose of the parameter

UrlRewriteAction.description: Defines the url rewrite action for the delivery rule.

parameters.description: Defines the parameters for the action.

UrlRewriteActionParameters.description: Defines the parameters for the url rewrite action.

sourcePattern.description: define a request URI pattern that identifies the type of requests that may be rewritten. If value is blank, all strings are matched.

destination.description: Define the relative URL to which the above requests will be rewritten by.

preserveUnmatchedPath.description: Whether to preserve unmatched path. Default value is true.

DeliveryRuleRequestHeaderAction.description: Defines the request header action for the delivery rule.

parameters.description: Defines the parameters for the action.

DeliveryRuleResponseHeaderAction.description: Defines the response header action for the delivery rule.

parameters.description: Defines the parameters for the action.

HeaderActionParameters.description: Defines the parameters for the request header action.

headerName.description: Name of the header to modify

value.description: Value for the specified action

DeliveryRuleCacheExpirationAction.description: Defines the cache expiration action for the delivery rule.

parameters.description: Defines the parameters for the action.

CacheExpirationActionParameters.description: Defines the parameters for the cache expiration action.

cacheType.description: The level at which the content needs to be cached.

cacheDuration.description: The duration for which the content needs to be cached. Allowed format is [d.]hh:mm:ss

DeliveryRuleCacheKeyQueryStringAction.description: Defines the cache-key query string action for the delivery rule.

parameters.description: Defines the parameters for the action.

CacheKeyQueryStringActionParameters.description: Defines the parameters for the cache-key query string action.

queryParameters.description: query parameters to include or exclude (comma separated).

transform.description: Describes what transforms are applied before matching

DeepCreatedOrigin.description: The main origin of CDN content which is added when creating a CDN endpoint.

name.description: Origin name which must be unique within the endpoint.

DeepCreatedOriginProperties.description: Properties of the origin created on the CDN endpoint.

hostName.description: The address of the origin. It can be a domain name, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address. This should be unique across all origins in an endpoint.

httpPort.description: The value of the HTTP port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

httpsPort.description: The value of the HTTPS port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

originHostHeader.description: The host header value sent to the origin with each request. If you leave this blank, the request hostname determines this value. Azure CDN origins, such as Web Apps, Blob Storage, and Cloud Services require this host header value to match the origin hostname by default.

priority.description: Priority of origin in given origin group for load balancing. Higher priorities will not be used for load balancing if any lower priority origin is healthy.Must be between 1 and 5.

weight.description: Weight of the origin in given origin group for load balancing. Must be between 1 and 1000

enabled.description: Origin is enabled for load balancing or not. By default, origin is always enabled.

DeepCreatedOriginGroup.description: The origin group for CDN content which is added when creating a CDN endpoint. Traffic is sent to the origins within the origin group based on origin health.

name.description: Origin group name which must be unique within the endpoint.

DeepCreatedOriginGroupProperties.description: Properties of the origin group created on the CDN endpoint.

healthProbeSettings.description: Health probe settings to the origin that is used to determine the health of the origin.

origins.description: The source of the content being delivered via CDN within given origin group.

trafficRestorationTimeToHealedOrNewEndpo.description: Time in minutes to shift the traffic to the endpoint gradually when an unhealthy endpoint comes healthy or a new endpoint is added. Default is 10 mins. This property is currently not supported.

responseBasedOriginErrorDetectionSetting.description: The JSON object that contains the properties to determine origin health using real requests/responses.This property is currently not supported.

GeoFilter.description: Rules defining user's geo access within a CDN endpoint.

relativePath.description: Relative path applicable to geo filter. (e.g. '/mypictures', '/mypicture/kitty.jpg', and etc.)

action.description: Action of the geo filter, i.e. allow or block access.

countryCodes.description: Two letter country codes defining user country access in a geo filter, e.g. AU, MX, US.

contentPaths.description: The path to the content to be purged. Can describe a file path or a wild card directory.

keyId.description: Defines the customer defined key Id. This id will exist in the incoming request to indicate the key used to form the hash.

isAutorotated.description: Whether autorotation enabled for the certificate

LinkedKeyvaults.description: List of associated Keyvaults under the profile.

value.description: List of linked Keyvaults for a profile.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of linked Keyvaults, if any.

contentPaths.description: The path to the content to be loaded. Path should be a relative file URL of the origin.

Origin.description: CDN origin is the source of the content being delivered via CDN. When the edge nodes represented by an endpoint do not have the requested content cached, they attempt to fetch it from one or more of the configured origins.

OriginProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin.

privateEndpointStatus.description: The approval status for the connection to the Private Link

OriginUpdateParameters.description: Origin properties needed for origin update.

OriginUpdatePropertiesParameters.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin.

hostName.description: The address of the origin. Domain names, IPv4 addresses, and IPv6 addresses are supported.This should be unique across all origins in an endpoint.

httpPort.description: The value of the HTTP port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

httpsPort.description: The value of the HTTPS port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

originHostHeader.description: The host header value sent to the origin with each request. If you leave this blank, the request hostname determines this value. Azure CDN origins, such as Web Apps, Blob Storage, and Cloud Services require this host header value to match the origin hostname by default. This overrides the host header defined at Endpoint

priority.description: Priority of origin in given origin group for load balancing. Higher priorities will not be used for load balancing if any lower priority origin is healthy.Must be between 1 and 5

weight.description: Weight of the origin in given origin group for load balancing. Must be between 1 and 1000

enabled.description: Origin is enabled for load balancing or not

privateLinkAlias.description: The Alias of the Private Link resource. Populating this optional field indicates that this origin is 'Private'

privateLinkResourceId.description: The Resource Id of the Private Link resource. Populating this optional field indicates that this backend is 'Private'

privateLinkLocation.description: The location of the Private Link resource. Required only if 'privateLinkResourceId' is populated

privateLinkApprovalMessage.description: A custom message to be included in the approval request to connect to the Private Link.

OriginListResult.description: Result of the request to list origins. It contains a list of origin objects and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of CDN origins within an endpoint

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of origin objects if there are any.

OriginGroup.description: Origin group comprising of origins is used for load balancing to origins when the content cannot be served from CDN.

OriginGroupProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin group.

resourceState.description: Resource status of the origin group.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning status of the origin group.

OriginGroupUpdateParameters.description: Origin group properties needed for origin group creation or update.

OriginGroupUpdatePropertiesParameters.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin group.

healthProbeSettings.description: Health probe settings to the origin that is used to determine the health of the origin.

origins.description: The source of the content being delivered via CDN within given origin group.

trafficRestorationTimeToHealedOrNewEndpo.description: Time in minutes to shift the traffic to the endpoint gradually when an unhealthy endpoint comes healthy or a new endpoint is added. Default is 10 mins. This property is currently not supported.

responseBasedOriginErrorDetectionSetting.description: The JSON object that contains the properties to determine origin health using real requests/responses. This property is currently not supported.

HealthProbeParameters.description: The JSON object that contains the properties to send health probes to origin.

probePath.description: The path relative to the origin that is used to determine the health of the origin.

probeRequestType.description: The type of health probe request that is made.

probeProtocol.description: Protocol to use for health probe.

probeIntervalInSeconds.description: The number of seconds between health probes.Default is 240sec.

enabledState.description: Whether to enable health probes to be made against backends defined under backendPools. Health probes can only be disabled if there is a single enabled backend in single enabled backend pool.

ResponseBasedOriginErrorDetectionParamet.description: The JSON object that contains the properties to determine origin health using real requests/responses.

responseBasedDetectedErrorTypes.description: Type of response errors for real user requests for which origin will be deemed unhealthy

responseBasedFailoverThresholdPercentage.description: The percentage of failed requests in the sample where failover should trigger.

httpErrorRanges.description: The list of Http status code ranges that are considered as server errors for origin and it is marked as unhealthy.

HttpErrorRangeParameters.description: The JSON object that represents the range for http status codes

begin.description: The inclusive start of the http status code range.

end.description: The inclusive end of the http status code range.

CustomDomain.description: Friendly domain name mapping to the endpoint hostname that the customer provides for branding purposes, e.g. www.contoso.com.

resourceState.description: Resource status of the custom domain.

validationData.description: Special validation or data may be required when delivering CDN to some regions due to local compliance reasons. E.g. ICP license number of a custom domain is required to deliver content in China.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning status of the custom domain.

hostName.description: The host name of the custom domain. Must be a domain name.

EdgenodeResult.description: Result of the request to list CDN edgenodes. It contains a list of ip address group and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: Edge node of CDN service.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of edgenode list results if there are any.

EdgeNode.description: Edgenode is a global Point of Presence (POP) location used to deliver CDN content to end users.

EdgeNodeProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create an edgenode.

deliveryRegion.description: The delivery region of the ip address group

ipv4Addresses.description: The list of ip v4 addresses.

ipv6Addresses.description: The list of ip v6 addresses.

prefixLength.description: The length of the prefix of the ip address.

Resource.description: The core properties of ARM resources

TrackedResource.description: The resource model definition for a ARM tracked top level resource.

ProxyResource.description: The resource model definition for a ARM proxy resource. It will have everything other than required location and tags

QueryStringCachingBehavior.description: Defines how CDN caches requests that include query strings. You can ignore any query strings when caching, bypass caching to prevent requests that contain query strings from being cached, or cache every request with a unique URL.

Sku.description: The pricing tier (defines a CDN provider, feature list and rate) of the CDN profile.

OptimizationType.description: Specifies what scenario the customer wants this CDN endpoint to optimize, e.g. Download, Media services. With this information we can apply scenario driven optimization.

ErrorResponse.description: Error response indicates CDN service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

dnsSettings.description: The configuration specifying how to set DNS configuraiton.

httpsSettings.description: The configuration specifying how to enable HTTPS for the domain - using AFDX managed certificate or user's own certificate. If not specified, enabling ssl uses AFDX managed certificate by default.

ownershipIdentifier.description: Challenge used for DNS TXT record or file based validation

AFDEndpoint.description: CDN endpoint is the entity within a CDN profile containing configuration information such as origin, protocol, content caching and delivery behavior. The AFDX endpoint uses the URL format <endpointname>.azureedge.net.

AFDEndpointProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create an endpoint.

hostName.description: The host name of the endpoint structured as {endpointName}.{DNSZone}, e.g. contoso.azureedge.net

AFDEndpointListResult.description: Result of the request to list endpoints. It contains a list of endpoint objects and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of AFDX endpoints within a profile

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of endpoint objects if there is any.

AFDEndpointUpdateParameters.description: Properties required to create or update an endpoint.

AFDEndpointPropertiesUpdateParameters.description: The JSON object containing endpoint update parameters.

webApplicationFirewallPolicy.description: Defines the Web Application Firewall policy for the endpoint (if applicable)

originResponseTimeoutSeconds.description: Send and receive timeout on forwarding request to the origin. When timeout is reached, the request fails and returns.

enabledState.description: Whether to enable use of this rule. Permitted values are 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'

contentTypesToCompress.description: List of content types on which compression applies. The value should be a valid MIME type.

isCompressionEnabled.description: Indicates whether content compression is enabled on AFDX. Default value is false. If compression is enabled, content will be served as compressed if user requests for a compressed version. Content won't be compressed on AFDX when requested content is smaller than 1 byte or larger than 1 MB.

WAFPolicy.description: Defines the Web Application Firewall policy for the endpoint (if applicable)

WafPatternsToMatch.description: settings for WAF patterns to match.

AFDEndpointProtocols.description: Supported protocols for the customer's endpoint.

Secret.description: Friendly Secret name mapping to the any Secret or secret related information.

SecretProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the Secret to create.

type.description: The type of the Secret to create.

SecretUpdateParameters.description: The domain JSON object required for Secret update.

SecretUpdatePropertiesParameters.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the domain to create.

RuleSetListResult.description: Result of the request to list rule sets. It contains a list of rule set objects and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of AFDX rule sets within a profile.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of rule set objects if there are any.

RuleSet.description: Friendly RuleSet name mapping to the any RuleSet or secret related information.

RuleSetProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the Rule Set to create.

RuleSetUpdateParameters.description: The rule set JSON object required for rule set creation or update.

RuleSetUpdatePropertiesParameters.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the domain to create.

order.description: The order in which the rules are applied for the endpoint. Possible values {0,1,2,3,………}. A rule with a lesser order will be applied before a rule with a greater order. Rule with order 0 is a special rule. It does not require any condition and actions listed in it will always be applied.

AFDOrigin.description: CDN origin is the source of the content being delivered via CDN. When the edge nodes represented by an endpoint do not have the requested content cached, they attempt to fetch it from one or more of the configured origins.

AFDOriginProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin.

privateEndpointStatus.description: The approval status for the connection to the Private Link

AFDOriginUpdateParameters.description: AFDOrigin properties needed for origin update.

AFDOriginUpdatePropertiesParameters.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin.

hostName.description: The address of the origin. Domain names, IPv4 addresses, and IPv6 addresses are supported.This should be unique across all origins in an endpoint.

httpPort.description: The value of the HTTP port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

httpsPort.description: The value of the HTTPS port. Must be between 1 and 65535.

originHostHeader.description: The host header value sent to the origin with each request. If you leave this blank, the request hostname determines this value. Azure CDN origins, such as Web Apps, Blob Storage, and Cloud Services require this host header value to match the origin hostname by default. This overrides the host header defined at Endpoint

priority.description: Priority of origin in given origin group for load balancing. Higher priorities will not be used for load balancing if any lower priority origin is healthy.Must be between 1 and 5

weight.description: Weight of the origin in given origin group for load balancing. Must be between 1 and 1000

enabledState.description: Whether to enable health probes to be made against backends defined under backendPools. Health probes can only be disabled if there is a single enabled backend in single enabled backend pool.

privateLinkAlias.description: The Alias of the Private Link resource. Populating this optional field indicates that this origin is 'Private'

privateLinkResourceId.description: The Resource Id of the Private Link resource. Populating this optional field indicates that this backend is 'Private'

privateLinkLocation.description: The location of the Private Link resource. Required only if 'privateLinkResourceId' is populated

privateLinkApprovalMessage.description: A custom message to be included in the approval request to connect to the Private Link.

AFDOriginListResult.description: Result of the request to list origins. It contains a list of origin objects and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of CDN origins within an endpoint

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of origin objects if there are any.

AFDOriginGroup.description: AFDOrigin group comprising of origins is used for load balancing to origins when the content cannot be served from CDN.

AFDOriginGroupProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin group.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning status of the origin group.

AFDOriginGroupUpdateParameters.description: AFDOrigin group properties needed for origin group creation or update.

AFDOriginGroupUpdatePropertiesParameters.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the origin group.

loadBalancingSettings.description: Load balancing settings for a backend pool

healthProbeSettings.description: Health probe settings to the origin that is used to determine the health of the origin.

trafficRestorationTimeToHealedOrNewEndpo.description: Time in minutes to shift the traffic to the endpoint gradually when an unhealthy endpoint comes healthy or a new endpoint is added. Default is 10 mins. This property is currently not supported.

responseBasedAFDOriginErrorDetectionSett.description: The JSON object that contains the properties to determine origin health using real requests/responses. This property is currently not supported.

LoadBalancingSettingsParameters.description: Round-Robin load balancing settings for a backend pool

sampleSize.description: The number of samples to consider for load balancing decisions

successfulSamplesRequired.description: The number of samples within the sample period that must succeed

additionalLatencyMilliseconds.description: The additional latency in milliseconds for probes to fall into the lowest latency bucket

value.description: List of CDN origin groups within an endpoint

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of origin objects if there are any.

RouteListResult.description: Result of the request to list routes. It contains a list of route objects and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of AFDX routes within a profile.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of route objects if there are any.

Route.description: Friendly Routes name mapping to the any Routes or secret related information.

RouteProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the Routes to create.

RouteUpdateParameters.description: The domain JSON object required for domain creation or update.

RouteUpdatePropertiesParameters.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the domain to create.

originGroup.description: A reference to the origin group.

originPath.description: A directory path on the origin that AFDX can use to retrieve content from, e.g. contoso.cloudapp.net/originpath.

ruleSet.description: rule set referenced by this endpoint.

supportedProtocols.description: List of supported protocols for this route.

patternsToMatch.description: The route patterns of the rule.

items.description: A route pattern of the rule. Must not have any * except possibly after the final / at the end of the path.

queryStringCachingBehavior.description: Defines how AFDX caches requests that include query strings. You can ignore any query strings when caching, bypass caching to prevent requests that contain query strings from being cached, or cache every request with a unique URL.

optimizationType.description: Specifies what scenario the customer wants this AFDX endpoint to optimize for, e.g. Download, Media services. With this information, AFDX can apply scenario driven optimization.

sessionAffinityEnabledState.description: Whether to allow session affinity on this host. Valid options are 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'

forwardingProtocol.description: Protocol this rule will use when forwarding traffic to backends.

HTTPSRedirect.description: Whether to automatically redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS traffic. Note that this is a easy way to set up this rule and it will be the first rule that gets executed.

enableState.description: Whether to enable use of this rule. Permitted values are 'Enabled' or 'Disabled'

RuleListResult.description: Result of the request to list rules. It contains a list of rule objects and a URL link to get the next set of results.

value.description: List of AFDX rules within a rule set.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of rule objects if there are any.

Rule.description: Friendly Rules name mapping to the any Rules or secret related information.

RuleProperties.description: The JSON object that contains the properties of the Rules to create.

RuleUpdateParameters.description: The domain JSON object required for domain creation or update.

order.description: The order in which the rules are applied for the endpoint. Possible values {0,1,2,3,………}. A rule with a lesser order will be applied before a rule with a greater order. Rule with order 0 is a special rule. It does not require any condition and actions listed in it will always be applied.

name.description: A name to refer to this specific rule.

conditions.description: A list of conditions that must be matched for the actions to be executed

actions.description: A list of actions that are executed when all the conditions of a rule are satisfied.

matchProcessingBehavior.description: If this rule is a match should the rules engine continue running the remaining rules or stop. If not present, defaults to Continue.

value.description: A string describing the resource name.

localizedValue.description: A localized string describing the resource name.

unit.description: An enum describing the unit of measurement.

name.description: The name of the type of usage.
